title: Rift guardian

properties.name: description
properties.value: The rift guardian is a members-only skilling pet that can be obtained while training Runecraft. The chances of getting it are dependent on the player's Runecraft level, the rune the player is crafting, and the number of essence used. Upon using the Guardian's eye on it, which is purchased from the Guardians of the Rift reward shop for 3,000 abyssal pearls, players can use it to change it into the Greatish guardian.

SMW Subobject for MindExamine: An abyssal rift guardian.Is members only: trueIs variant of: Rift guardianUses infobox: ItemImage: File:Rift guardian (mind).pngWeight: 0.015Value: 1Version anchor: MindRelease date: 1 September 2016Item ID: 20669

The rift guardian is a members-only skilling pet that can be obtained while training Runecraft. The chances of getting it are dependent on the player's Runecraft level, the rune the player is crafting, and the number of essence used. Upon using the Guardian's eye on it, which is purchased from the Guardians of the Rift reward shop for 3,000 abyssal pearls, players can use it to change it into the Greatish guardian.

When a player receives the pet, it will automatically try to appear as their follower. At the same time, a red message in the chatbox will state You have a funny feeling like you're being followed.

When Blood and Soul Runecrafting, the pet is given after the dense essence fragments are removed and the runes are given back.[1] This means if there is not already some of the runes to be crafted in the inventory, and the rest of the inventory is full, and a pet is already following the player, the Rift Guardian will not be given.

On death, if a player loses their pet (as a follower or in your inventory) it will wander around for 30 seconds, but is lost instantly.

Players can pay a one-time fee of 500,000 coins to Probita in East Ardougne to have this pet insured. If the pet is lost while insured, it can be reclaimed for 1,000,000 coins.

Contents

  • 1 Colours
  • 2 Drop rates
  • 3 Conversion
  • 4 Dialogue
  • 5 References

Colours[edit | edit source]

The colour of the pet received is dependent on the altar at which the player's runes were crafted. Players can change its colour by crafting a rune at the desired runic altar while it is following the player. Thus, various colours will require different Runecraft levels. When runecrafting at the Ourania Altar it will turn into a random colour, but not necessarily one of the runes the player has crafted.

Should players wish to keep their rift guardian the same colour, they may do so via the right-click "Locking" option while it is following the player.

Altar Image Altar Image Altar Image Altar Image
Air Altar Mind Altar Water Altar Earth Altar
Fire Altar Body Altar Cosmic Altar Chaos Altar
Astral Altar Nature Altar Law Altar Death Altar
Blood Altar
Blood Altar (Kourend) 		Soul Altar Wrath Altar Guardian's eye

Drop rates[edit | edit source]

Shown below are the base chances of receiving a rift guardian.[2] The pet chance is rolled per essence crafted, not per rune crafted.

A player's actual chances of receiving it is 1 in B - (Lvl * 25), where B is the base chance and Lvl is the player's Runecraft level.

The fastest method on average (excluding the use of runners) to receive the rift guardian is by crafting mind runes, using the Mind Altar Teleport. However, lava runes are recommended, as they are only slightly slower for receiving the pet, but they are significantly better for experience.

Crafting on runic altars during the Guardians of the Rift minigame will not give players the pet.[3]

Rune Base chance
Blood runes (Arceuus) 804,984
Soul runes 782,999
Ourania Altar 1,487,213[4]
Everything else 1,795,758

Through a simulation, the following pet chances were calculated:

Method Lvl Begin Lvl End Essence Crafted Pet Chance
Lava runes (Fire Altar) 23 77 139,933 7.50%
Blood runes (Arceuus) 77 90 158,475 17.91%
Soul runes 90 99 253,524 27.73%
Lava runes (Fire Altar) 23 99 1,240,776 49.93%
Mind runes 89 99 1,489,480 56.42%

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ↑ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 24 December 2020. (Archived from the original on 6 March 2021.) Mod Ash: "It's after the fragments are removed, and also after the new blood runes are given. In your situation, the runes would stack with the ones you already had, so you'd have a free space for the pet to arrive."
  2. ↑ Jagex. Mod Kieren's Twitter account. 26 September 2016. (Archived from the original on 26 May 2020.) Mod Kieren: "Runecrafting pet rates! Retweet! Fairly straight forward one :). [1]"
  3. ↑ Jagex. Mod Elena's Twitter account. 30 March 2022. (Archived from the original on 30 March 2022.) Mod Elena: "[is it possible to get the rift guardian pet during a game of Guardians of the Rift?] Nope"
  4. ↑ Jagex. Mod Kieren's Twitter account. 27 September 2016. (Archived from the original on 26 May 2020.) Mod Kieren: "Just for awareness, having set out all the skillpet rates yesterday, the rate for ZMI will be 1,487,213 per essence for RC skillpet."

At the same time, a red message in the [[Chat Interface|chatbox]] will state {{Colour|#ef1020|You have a funny feeling like you're being followed.}} When Blood and Soul Runecrafting, the pet is given after the dense essence fragments are removed and the runes are given back.{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ash|url=https://twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/1342059488526925824|date=24 December 2020|archiveurl=https://archive.is/rgIni|archivedate=6 March 2021|quote=It's after the fragments are removed, and also after the new blood runes are given. In your situation, the runes would stack with the ones you already had, so you'd have a free space for the pet to arrive.}} This means if there is not already some of the runes to be crafted in the inventory, and the rest of the inventory is full, and a pet is already following the player, the Rift Guardian will '''not''' be given. On death, if a player loses their pet (as a follower or in your inventory) it will wander around for 30 seconds, but is lost instantly. Players can pay a one-time fee of 500,000 [[coins]] to [[Probita]] in [[East Ardougne]] to have this pet insured. If the pet is lost while insured, it can be reclaimed for 1,000,000 [[coins]]. ==Colours== The colour of the pet received is dependent on the altar at which the player's runes were crafted. Players can change its colour by crafting a rune at the desired [[runic altar]] while it is following the player. Thus, various colours will require different Runecraft levels. When runecrafting at the [[Ourania Altar]] it will turn into a random colour, but not necessarily one of the runes the player has crafted. Should players wish to keep their rift guardian the same colour, they may do so via the right-click "Locking" option while it is following the player. {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center;" ! {{plink|Blood Altar (Kourend)|pic=Blood rune}} |[[File:Rift guardian (follower, blood).png|100px]] |{{plink|Soul Altar|pic=Soul rune}} |[[File:Rift guardian (follower, soul).png|100px]] |{{plink|Wrath Altar|pic=Wrath rune}} |[[File:Rift guardian (follower, wrath).png|100px]] |{{plink|Guardian's eye}} |[[File:Greatish guardian (follower).png|100px]] |} ==Drop rates== Shown below are the base chances of receiving a rift guardian.{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Kieren|url=https://twitter.com/JagexKieren/status/780452024550731776|date=26 September 2016|archiveurl=https://archive.is/nOs68|archivedate=26 May 2020|quote=Runecrafting pet rates! Retweet! Fairly straight forward one :). [https://pbs.twimg.com/media/CtSXh51XYAAxsP3.jpg]}} The '''pet chance''' is '''rolled per essence crafted''', not per rune crafted. A player's actual chances of receiving it is '''1 in ''B'' - (''Lvl'' * 25)''', where ''B'' is the base chance and ''Lvl'' is the player's Runecraft level. The fastest method on average (excluding the use of [[Runecraft#Rune running|runners]]) to receive the rift guardian is by crafting [[mind runes]], using the [[Mind Altar Teleport]]. However, [[lava runes]] are recommended, as they are only slightly slower for receiving the pet, but they are significantly better for [[experience]]. Crafting on runic altars during the [[Guardians of the Rift]] [[minigame]] will '''not''' give players the pet.{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Elena|url=https://twitter.com/JagexElena/status/1509180405156622342|date=30 March 2022|archiveurl=https://archive.ph/sy3jt|archivedate=30 March 2022|quote=[is it possible to get the rift guardian pet during a game of Guardians of the Rift?] Nope}} {|class=wikitable |- !Rune !Base chance |- |[[Blood rune|Blood runes (Arceuus)]] |804,984 |- |[[Soul rune]]s |782,999 |- |[[Ourania Altar]] |1,487,213{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Kieren|url=https://twitter.com/JagexKieren/status/780697323026411520|date=27 September 2016|archiveurl=https://archive.is/6aaMM|archivedate=26 May 2020|quote=Just for awareness, having set out all the skillpet rates yesterday, the rate for ZMI will be 1,487,213 per essence for RC skillpet.}} |- |Everything else |1,795,758 |} Through a simulation, the following pet chances were calculated: {| class="wikitable" !Method !Lvl Begin !Lvl End !Essence Crafted !Pet Chance |- |[[Lava rune|Lava runes (Fire Altar)]] |23 |77 |139,933 |7.50% |- |[[Blood rune|Blood runes (Arceuus)]] |77 |90 |158,475 |17.91% |- |[[Soul rune]]s |90 |99 |253,524 |27.73% |- |[[Lava rune|Lava runes (Fire Altar)]] |23 |99 |1,240,776 |49.93% |- |[[Mind rune]]s |89 |99 |1,489,480 |56.42% |} ==Conversion== {{Recipe |members = yes |ticks = 0 |mat1 = Rift guardian |mat1cost = no |mat1pic = Rift guardian (fire) |mat2 = Guardian's eye |mat2cost = no |output1 = Greatish guardian |output1cost = no }} ==Dialogue== {{Hastranscript|Rift guardian}} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Guardians of the Rift}} {{Pets}}
